analyzedSegments.originalText: Integration or CI is a development practice where developers a integrate code and a shared repository frequently preferably several times a day each integration can then be verified but automated build an automated test well automated testing is not strictly part of Ci. It is typically implied one of the key benefits of integrating regularly is that you can detect errors quickly and locate them more easily as each change introduced and typically small pointing the specific change that introduced defect can be done quickly in recent year has become a best practice for software development is guided by set of key protocols among them are revision control build automation and automated testing. Additionally additional continuous deployment and continuous about delivery have developed as best practices for keeping your application deplorable at any point or even pushing your main code base automatically into production whenever new changes it brought into it. This allows your team to move fast while keeping high quality standards that can be checked automatically.

analyzedSegments.originalText: Ms is the software that would be installed on your personal computer or on a server. Then you would use it to manage one or more databases the database has your actual data and the rules about the data while the dBMs is the program that surrounds and manages your actual data and then that forces. The rules you specified on your data the rules for example could be the type of data like or stream or the relationship between them a database has broad certain searching functionality a database can update records and bulk even millions or more records. This would be useful for example, if you wanted to add new columns or client a data patch of some sort if a database is relational which most databases are they can cross reference records in different tables. This means that you can create relationships between tables database can perform complex aggregate calculations across multiple tables for example, you can list expenses across multiple retail admin, including all possible proposals and then a final total a database can enforce consistency and data integrity, which means that it can avoid duplication and ensure data accuracy see through design and a series of constraints.

analyzedSegments.originalText: Flew in marketing has become the industry hottest as go to strategy just take a look at all the celebrities on your social media feeds that are encouraging you to try beauty product a big claim you simply cannot learn without brands are investing big budgets and influence and marketing and by the opportunity to amplify their content and a attract business. But is this buzz where trend all that it's cracked up to being most importantly is a sustainable strategy for brand success the truth is influence and marketing was bound to be delivering to markets with the ongoing challenges of ad blocking and benefits fatigue digital ads have lost their appeal and marketers again, seeking alternative strategies and we to ad blocking influencer marketing makes a lot of sense, especially because consumers are already receptive to recommendations when they're shopping.

analyzedSegments.originalText: Multiple areas and talent management that you can focus on you can become a desirable employer being a top employer are being nominated as a great place to work require substantial investment and can be effective especially when you want to attract people with all kinds of backgrounds. However, if you have a very specific employee profile for example engineers your time is better spent on hiring from the top technical universities the H R talent management model is very helpful in this case as it enables you to map the specific activities that you want to focus on.

analyzedSegments.originalText: Advertise as part of your brand strategy your distribution channels are also part of your brand strategy and what you communicate visually verbally are part of your brand strategy too consistent strategic branding leads to a strong brand equity, which means the added value brought to your company's products and services that allows you to charge more for your brand than what identical branded products command the most obvious example of this is versus generic. So because coca cola has built a powerful brand equity. It can charge more for its product and customers will pay that higher price the added value and intrinsic to brand equity frequently comes in the form of perceive quality or emotional attachment. For example, Nike a*sociates products with store athlete hoping customers who transfer their emotional attachment from to the product for Nike. It's not just the shoes features that sell the shoe.
